metadata.title: CVE-2018-11508 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The compat_get_timex function in kernel/compat.c in the Linux kernel before4.16.9 allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernelmemory via adjtimex.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11508` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-4.15.0-24-snapdragon - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1013.14
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1011-aws - 4.15.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1014-azure - 4.15.0-1014.14
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1010-gcp - 4.15.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1012-kvm - 4.15.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1009-oem - 4.15.0-1009.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.14').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1011.11').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1010.10').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1012.12').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1009.12').
